oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHOALING PROPERTIES OF BOUNDED LONG WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mansard, E.P.D.
Barthel, V.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: shoaling
long waves
bounded waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Group bounded long waves which appear as a set-down under a group of high waves and a set-up in between groups are well described for constant water depth. However, their propagation into shallow water and their interaction with the constituent wave groups are not well understood and theoretically described yet. Therefore, model investigations were carried out to study shoaling properties of these second order waves in terms of amplitudes and phases. The tests give a good insight into the phenomenon and suggest distinct shoaling properties. Moreover, experimental results provide a valuable basis for future theoretical considerations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 54
